item.title: Government forces Air Canada and flight attendants back to work and into arbitration, after strike strands over 100,000 travelers
item.description: A complete shutdown will impact about 130,000 people a day, and some 25,000 Canadians may be stranded abroad daily. Air Canada operates around 700 fli...

item.title: OpenAI staffers to sell $6 billion in stock to SoftBank, other investors
item.description: The secondary share sale will give OpenAI employees a chance to get cash-rich amid a high-stakes talent war in the AI industry.

item.title: Trump’s reciprocal tariffs could be struck down as soon as this month — and the administration is warning of economic apocalypse
item.description: "In short, the economic consequences would be ruinous, instead of unprecedented success."

item.title: Airfares are surging again after a months-long slump as carriers trim flights to ease a capacity glut
item.description: The latest consumer price index report showed airfares jumped 4% in July from June, marking the first monthly increase since January.

item.title: Trump’s tax cut could mean a nearly half-trillion-dollar cut to Medicare starting in 2027, CBO warns
item.description: The $3.4 trillion that the tax and spending law adds to the federal deficit over the next decade means that many Medicare programs could see cuts.
